Grid

Our core styling makes use of a responsive, mobile first grid system of 12 columns which scale to the width of the viewport or wrapper.

Mobile first assumes that the base style relates to the mobile or smallest screen view. Each CSS media query is set using a min-width value to ensure any additional styling only applies to the larger viewport.

Gutters

Gutters (the space between columns) has been set to a default value of 15px. This value and multiples of it are used throughout the core styling to maintain consistency in spacing between elements.

Grid wrapper

The grid must be contained within an element with the class .wrapper.

The default wrapper is fluid, allowing the columns to scale to the device or viewport width.

Fixed width wrappers

Wrappers can have a maximum fixed width applied instead by using one of the following classes.

Wrapper class Max width
.wrapper--small 420px
.wrapper--medium 660px
.wrapper--large 960px
.wrapper--xlarge 1200px

Rows

Rows are specified by adding the class .row to a child element of the wrapper.

Rows have negative left and right margins of 7.5px to take into account the padding of the first and last columns in the row.

Columns

Columns should be immediate children of rows. The width of each column is determined by the classes applied to it (see below).

Column class Width
.col-12 100%
.col-11 96.66667%
.col-10 83.33333%
.col-9 75%
.col-8 66.66667%
.col-7 58.33333%
.col-6 50%
.col-5 41.66667%
.col-4 33.33333%
.col-3 25%
.col-2 16.66667%
.col-1 8.33333%

Each column has left and right padding of 7.5px, i.e. half the gutter width.

Breakpoint classes

Different column widths can be applied per breakpoint by using one of the following classes, replacing [NUMBER] with a column width of 1 to 12.

Column class Min width
.col-[NUMBER]--small 420px
.col-[NUMBER]--medium 660px
.col-[NUMBER]--large 960px
.col-[NUMBER]--xlarge 1200px

Example: Fluid grid with multiple breakpoints

Nesting

You can nest columns by adding a new row inside an existing column. Columns in nested rows work exactly the same as regular columns.

Example: Nested columns
